lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: How have things been going with your diabetes management?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Not great. My blood sugars have been all over the place and I'm feeling really tired all the time.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: What have your blood sugar readings been like?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: In the mornings they're around 180 to 200. After meals they sometimes go up to 250 or 300.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Are you taking your medications as prescribed?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I take metformin twice a day but I miss the evening dose two or three times a week.

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I've been eating out a lot because of work. I know I'm eating too many carbs.

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I try to walk for about 20 minutes a few times a week but I just don't have the energy.

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: My vision has been blurry in the mornings. It usually clears up after a couple of hours.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any numbness or tingling in your hands or feet?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: My feet have been feeling numb at night for a few weeks now.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: When was your last eye exam?

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Let me check your A1C today and we'll review your treatment plan.

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I want to get this under control. I'm worried about the long-term effects.
